result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Oren Jakobson appointed
Letter from Defendant in re:  request for for bond modification (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 02/16/22 sp)
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:14 PM Defendant Valerie Madonna Schulz by video from the Portage County Jail, in custody.   Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions the defendant with regards to being able to have counsel represent her.
Defendant wishes to have counsel represent her.
State does not object to adjourning.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Bond is continued.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
If an ATR (locked setting) is available then can be amended to a signature bond

1:17 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Controlled Substance. 
ADA Pfeil states that this is the same probable cause as Zjoran Hinton but defendant was not in room when recited so ADA Pfeil recited again.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 
Atty Soule indicates that the defendant is public defender eligible.

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record and would request either a signature bond or a lower cash bond.
Court believes that some cash is necessary and will set a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   02/14/2022 @ 1:15 p.m.  in Branch 2
